skill.name: neurokit2
skill.description: Comprehensive biosignal processing toolkit for analyzing physiological data including ECG, EEG, EDA, RSP, PPG, EMG, and EOG signals. Use this skill when processing cardiovascular signals, brain activity, electrodermal responses, respiratory patterns, muscle activity, or eye movements. Applicable for heart rate variability analysis, event-related potentials, complexity measures, autonomic nervous system assessment, psychophysiology research, and multi-modal physiological signal integration.
skill.summary: Comprehensive biosignal processing toolkit for analyzing physiological data including ECG, EEG, EDA,...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This skill is documentation for the NeuroKit2 Python library containing code examples and API documentation. The static analyzer incorrectly flagged markdown code blocks as security risks. No actual security issues found - all findings are false positives from documentation code examples.

content.value_statement: Process ECG, EEG, and other biosignals without writing complex code. Get instant access to 100+ signal processing algorithms for biomedical research.
actual_capabilities: Process ECG signals for heart rate variability analysis
Analyze EEG frequency bands and microstates
Extract respiratory patterns and variability metrics
Detect muscle activation from EMG signals
Create event-related epochs from trigger signals
limitations: Requires Python environment with NeuroKit2 installed
Documentation-only skill - no direct signal processing
Designed for research and educational purposes
Signal quality depends on input data quality

use_cases.title: Analyze clinical ECG data
use_cases.description: Process patient ECG recordings to extract heart rate variability metrics for cardiac health assessment

use_cases.title: Study stress responses
use_cases.description: Analyze skin conductance and heart rate changes during experimental stress paradigms

use_cases.title: Process EEG experiments
use_cases.description: Extract frequency band power and microstate dynamics from cognitive task EEG recordings

prompt_templates.title: Basic ECG Analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Process ECG signal for heart rate
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to process an ECG signal to extract heart rate using NeuroKit2. Include cleaning, R-peak detection, and visualization.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-signal Processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Demonstrate how to process ECG, EDA, and respiratory signals simultaneously using the bio_process function

prompt_templates.title: HRV Frequency Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate frequency domain heart rate variability metrics including LF, HF, and LF/HF ratio from R-peak data

prompt_templates.title: Event-Related Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Create epochs around stimulus triggers and compute event-related changes in ECG and EDA signals

output_examples.input: Process ECG signal and extract HRV metrics
output: HRV Frequency Domain: LF = 54%, HF = 46%, LF/HF = 1.17

best_practices: Always validate signal quality before analysis using built-in quality metrics
Use appropriate sampling rates (ECG: 1000Hz, EEG: 250-500Hz, EDA: 100Hz)
Apply proper filtering based on signal type and research question
anti_patterns: Don't analyze very short signals (<10s) for interval-related metrics
Avoid using default parameters without understanding their impact
Don't skip visual inspection of processed signals for artifacts

faq.question: What sampling rates should I use?
faq.answer: ECG: 1000Hz, EEG: 250-500Hz, EDA: 100Hz, EMG: 1000Hz, RSP: 100Hz, EOG: 500Hz

faq.question: Can I process multiple signals at once?
faq.answer: Yes, use nk.bio_process() to simultaneously process ECG, EDA, RSP, EMG, and other signals

faq.question: How do I handle poor quality signals?
faq.answer: Use quality assessment functions like nk.ecg_quality() and visual inspection before analysis

faq.question: What's the difference between event and interval analysis?
faq.answer: Event analysis (<10s) examines stimulus responses; interval analysis (â‰¥10s) characterizes ongoing patterns

faq.question: Can I visualize my results?
faq.answer: Yes, NeuroKit2 includes plotting functions like nk.ecg_plot(), nk.eda_plot(), and nk.signal_plot()

faq.question: Is NeuroKit2 suitable for clinical use?
faq.answer: NeuroKit2 is designed for research. Clinical applications require additional validation and regulatory approval
